original: II.LICENSE CONDITION PRECEDENT: THE GRANTING OF ANY AND ALL LICENSES OR PRIVILEGES HEREIN IS SUBJECT THE THE SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF A FIVE PERSON MINIMUM CLINICAL TRIAL IN THE KINGDOM OF SAUDI ARABIA TREATING EARLY ONSET PATIENTS INFECTED WITH MERS.
ollama_generated:
II.LICENSE GRANT CONTINGENCY: The granting of any and all licenses or privileges herein is dependent upon the initiation, rather than the successful completion, of a minimum five-person clinical trial in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, targeting early onset patients infected with MERS, subject to the condition that such trial commences within six months from the effective date of this agreement.

In this revised clause, the obligation has been weakened by changing the requirement from successfully completing a trial to simply initiating one within a specified timeframe. The responsibility for the success or failure of the trial now lies with the parties involved in conducting it, rather than being an absolute prerequisite for license granting.

original: Page 17 of 28 HEMISPHERX may perform audits for initial qualification of  SCIEN as well as periodic audits and “for cause” audits. At mutually agreed upon times, HEMISPHERX may review standard operating and other quality control procedures and records and the records of  SCIEN relating to the Agreement. Such routine and general oversight review is to be requested at least twenty (20) business days in advance, limited to two (2) persons, completed within one (1) to two (2) business days and shall be offered to HEMISPHERX one (1) time each calendar year.  SCIEN will make every reasonable effort to accommodate the special circumstances that may arise pursuant to “for cause” audits. The following applies to all audits:
ollama_generated: Page 17 of 28: SCien grants HEMISPHERX the right to conduct initial qualification audits, periodic reviews, and audits for cause. At mutually convenient intervals, HEMISPHERX may scrutinize our standard operating procedures, quality control records, and documents pertaining to this Agreement, with prior notice of at least twenty (20) business days. These reviews will be confined to a maximum of two (2) personnel, and the completion timeline shall extend up to four (4) business days. HEMISPHERX is entitled to request such oversight reviews no more than twice annually. In case of "for cause" audits, SCien shall make every reasonable effort to cooperate and accommodate the unique circumstances arising. For all audits, it should be noted that HEMISPHERX bears the responsibility for scheduling the review and obtaining any necessary approvals or extensions.

original: For example, under this definition, hepatic necrosis would be unexpected (by virtue of greater severity) if the labeling only referred to elevated hepatic enzymes or hepatitis. Similarly, cerebral thromboembolism and cerebral vasculitis would be unexpected (by virtue of greater specificity) if the labeling only listed cerebral vascular accidents. “Unexpected,” as used in this definition, refers to an adverse experience that has not been previously observed (i.e., included in the labeling) rather than from the perspective of such experience not being anticipated from the pharmacological properties of the pharmaceutical product.
ollama_generated: Under this definition, instances of hepatic necrosis would be unforeseen (in terms of degree of severity) if the labeling primarily encompassed only elevated hepatic enzymes or hepatitis. Likewise, cerebral thromboembolism and cerebral vasculitis would be unforeseen (in terms of particularity) if the labeling solely listed cerebral vascular incidents. The term "unforeseen," as employed in this context, signifies an adverse event that has not been documented (previously recorded within the labeling) rather than an incident that was not expected based on the known pharmacological properties of the pharmaceutical product.

original: Call report : A list of all questions, requests for circulars, and physician/patient complaints received by  SCIEN's Clinical Support Department is prepared monthly by  SCIEN staff and is forwarded to HEMISPHERX RA/QA Department.
modified:
Monthly Report on Calls: A summary of all queries, solicitations for circulars, and complaints received from physicians or patients regarding SCIEN's Clinical Support Department are compiled by the HEMISPHERX RA/QA Department from records maintained by SCIEN staff.

Explanation: In this revised clause, responsibility for compiling the report is shifted from SCIEN staff to the HEMISPHERX RA/QA Department. The original clause required SCIEN to prepare and send a monthly report; in the new version, HEMISPHEREX will compile a report based on records maintained by SCIEN staff, which weakens the obligation for SCIEN to actively produce the report each month.

original: Good Manufacturing Practices (“GMPs”):  The recognized pharmaceutical regulations and requirements of regulatory authorities such as those defined by the U.S. FDA’s regulations at 21CFR Parts 210 and 211.
ollama_generated: Compliance with Good Manufacturing Practices (“GMPs”): The manufacturer shall adhere to generally accepted pharmaceutical guidelines, following the recommendations of regulatory bodies such as the U.S. FDA's outlined regulations in 21CFR Parts 210 and 211, while acknowledging that these practices are subject to change and interpretation by said authorities.

original: Page 19 of 28 oMajor: Does not fully comply with regulations, guidelines or corporate policies and may pose unnecessary risks to the integrity or quality of material, product, process or service being provided. Other instances that could be defined as a major observation include: Likely or probable safety risk to personnel; Quality System(s) weak or needing improvement; repeated Minor deficiencies of a similar nature that indicate a systemic problem and therefore may be classified as Major.
ollama_generated: Page 19 of 28 - Major: While adhering generally to regulations, guidelines, or corporate policies, there may exist instances where the provided material, product, process, or service slightly deviates from these standards, potentially introducing minimal risks to integrity or quality. However, observations that suggest potential safety hazards to personnel, require immediate attention and improvement in Quality System(s), or display recurring Minor deficiencies indicative of a systemic issue should be considered as Major non-compliance.

1) The responsibility for ensuring that the product adheres to all manufacturing and quality control testing requirements lies with you. Once satisfied that these requirements have been met, you are authorized to release the product.

2) You shall provide all necessary quality documentation pertaining to your shipments. This documentation is essential for the importation and release of the product.

3) It is your obligation to ensure that products intended for supply within a territory are appropriately labeled according to local regulations.

When a non- conformance event occurs HEMISPHERX will conduct an investigation and inform SCIEN of any appropriate action to be taken 11) for initiating, monitoring and completing CAPA tasks related to discrepancies, errors and incidents involving services that are under HEMISPHERX’s control 12) contribute to customer complaint investigations where possible issues due to manufacturing process may have contributed to complaint HEMISPHERX and SCIEN are separately responsible for securing and maintaining all required licenses, permits and certificates applicable to their respective operations and each shall comply with any and all applicable federal, state and local laws, including but not limited to (i) the Federal Food Drug and Cosmetic Act; (ii) the Social Security Act; (iii) HIPAA; (iv) all federal and state health care anti-fraud and abuse laws, and (v) all state privacy, and consumer protection laws, including those relating to the use of medical and prescription information for commercial purposes.

Page 21 of 28:
9) While HEMISPHERX remains responsible for making timely reports to the FDA regarding any serious and unexpected side effects, SCIEN is entitled to be informed of such reports, if deemed necessary by HEMISPHERX.
10) SCIEN shall be notified of any events of non-conformance that may potentially impact the quality of HEMISPHERE's product. It is important to note that this obligation applies only when HEMISPHERE becomes aware of such events, and does not extend to proactive identification. Examples of non- conformances may include, but are not limited to: contamination, calculation or documentation error, labeling error. Upon the occurrence of a non-conformance event, HEMISPHERE will conduct an investigation, but is not obligated to inform SCIEN of any appropriate action taken unless explicitly requested.
11) HEMISPHEREX shall be responsible for initiating, monitoring, and completing CAPA tasks related to discrepancies, errors, and incidents involving services under its control, except where SCIEN's involvement is expressly required or mutually agreed upon.
12) HEMISPHEREX and SCIEN shall each maintain all required licenses, permits, and certificates applicable to their respective operations and comply with any and all applicable federal, state, and local laws. However, in the event of a conflict between such laws, the party primarily responsible for the operation in question shall bear responsibility for ensuring compliance. This includes, but is not limited to (i) the Federal Food Drug and Cosmetic Act; (ii) the Social Security Act; (iii) HIPAA; (iv) all federal and state health care anti-fraud and abuse laws, and (v) all state privacy, and consumer protection laws, including those relating to the use of medical and prescription information for commercial purposes. In instances where there is shared responsibility, both parties shall collaborate to achieve compliance.

modified:
Quality Assurance Certification: _____________________________________________________ Digital Signature: Victoria Scott Role: Associate Director Quality and Regulatory Date: _________________________________________________________________________ Leadership Approval Signature: __________________________________________________________ Printed Name: Wayne Springate Position: Senior Vice President Operations Date: _________________________________________________________________________ SCIEN.

Changes made:
1. "Quality Assurance Signature" to "Quality Assurance Certification" - This change signifies that the individual is certifying the quality, rather than signing off on it.
2. "Printed Name" to "Digital Signature" - This change reflects the increasingly digital nature of modern business and legal documents.
3. "Management Signature" to "Leadership Approval Signature" - This change broadens the responsibility from just management to leadership, potentially including other key personnel in the approval process.

original: Page 26 of 28 Attachment 3 HEMISPHERX Return Goods Policy This Return Goods Policy us for all HEMISPHERX product, Interferon alfa-n3 (human leukocyte derived) distributed by  SCIEN.

Page 26 of 28 Attachment 3 HEMISPHERX Goods Return Procedure This Procedure shall govern the return of all HEMISPHERX products, specifically Interferon alfa-n3 (human leukocyte derived), supplied by SCIEN, subject to their discretion and approval.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for returning goods has been shifted from the buyer to the supplier (SCIEN) by adding the condition that they must approve any return and exercise their discretion in the process. This change implies a greater control over the returns process for SCIEN.
